revised_title: Medal Awardees of the Royal Society in 1985: Contributions to Science and Engineering
tldr: The article highlights the achievements of various scientists and engineers who were awarded medals by the President of the Royal Society, Sir Andrew Huxley, in 1985. The awardees contributed significantly to fields such as gravitational collapse, nuclear transplantation, finite element analysis, metal cluster compounds, and materials science. Their work has had a profound impact on various scientific disciplines and engineering applications.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Biographies and Book Reviews
